sub_title: Global Product Management - DC fast charging solutions for e-fleets and buses at ABB E-mobility
summary:
I'm a passionate innovator. I love to gauge business potential in anything as such. After pursuing an MSc degree within energy optimization and sustainability, I gathered co-founders to start DC Hive. The idea came after a brief stint at 'The Green Village', working on Direct Current hardware systems. With DC Hive we aimed to fill the market gap of easy to use and install power distribution hardware that smartly connects PV generation, electric vehicles, LED lighting and electronic devices. After 4 months of hardcore market validation (through Yes!Delft Validation Lab and European Climate-KIC programme) we decided to take the bottom-up approach (pivot) of building user centric hardware that provides power charging, data as well as audio-visual capabilities. User experience and ease of use was given priority while designing our first product for the office environment. On our journey, we achieved many milestones and personally I learnt a whole lot about product development, B2B sales, importance of having the right team members, cash flow modeling and legal due diligence. Through some exciting projects, I also sharpened my data analysis skills. We also fulfilled grants and projects worth ~ 250k EUR. Due to some technical bottlenecks, I will be leaving my role within DC Hive to further my thirst of building genuine products/solutions.

Moving ahead, I'm looking at interesting opportunities that lets me use my founder experience and help grow scale-ups/corporate innovations.

awards.title: Honours Programme Delft
awards.description: The Honours Programme Delft is for bachelor’s and master’s students looking for a challenge over and above what their curriculum offers. It’s a challenging additional programme for students with higher than average performance.

projects.title: Reactor Institue Delft: Li4Ti5O12 as a feasible anode material for Lithium Batteries
projects.description:
Objective- Individual project to optimize the Li4Ti5O12 (LTO) code to be used as a suitable anode material in lithium batteries.
• Working at the Reactor Institute in Delft to maximize the active material content, keeping the carbon and binder content to a minimum. Testing the results on MACCOR to compare specific capacity (mAh/gm).
• Tested alternate electrolyte compositions on Cyclic Voltammetry measurements.
• Achieved good cyclability, superior charging/discharging rates and reached towards the theoretical
capacity of LTO: 3mAh/cm2.

contributors.headline: Global Product Management - DC fast charging solutions for e-fleets and buses at ABB E-mobility

projects.title: System Integration Project I
projects.description:
Objective- The aim was to design and model a microgrid and control system in Freiburg, Germany.
• Tested various distributed energy sources such as wind turbines, solar photovoltaics, fuel cells and energy storage (lithium batteries) for feasibility and integrated them in a Low Voltage electrical connection to electrify 100 households.
• Designed a control model on MATLAB to respond to the different loads in changing ambient conditions.
• Achieved to optimize the power sources to have an autonomous system running for atleast a week
without extracting power from the utility grid.

contributors.headline: Global Product Management - DC fast charging solutions for e-fleets and buses at ABB E-mobility
PhD Student at SUPSI and EPFL
Energy Storage Systems | Solar PV | EV

projects.title: Biomass Plant Design
projects.description:
Objective- To design a comprehensive layout of the process involved in the production of bio-ethanol from wheat stock was studied and presented.
• Prepared a kinetic model to determine the retention times and the volume of the reactor, thus sizing the bio refinery to an apt size for the consumption of 1 Ton of wheat straw in 1 hour.
• Optimized the biochemical process to produce a ton of bioethanol for an input of 7.5 tons of wheat
straw.

projects.title: Blue Star: Market Introduction of Reefer Vehicle
projects.description:
Worked in a team of 2 to present technology viability and market evaluation of truck refrigeration systems. I worked on the product technology analysis.
Responsible to conduct exhaustive desk research to understand reefer unit specifications and design, gain insights through stakeholder meetings.
Recommended a solution to use greater capacity compressors and R404A refrigerant to withstand Indian temperatures and constant door openings of the reefer vehicle.

contributors.headline: Global Product Management - DC fast charging solutions for e-fleets and buses at ABB E-mobility

projects.title: Pedal Operated Pump
projects.description:
Objective- With a sole intention to reduce physical efforts of people in electricity deprived rural India, a bicycle pedal was designed to drive a pump which ultimately propelled water to certain heights.
• The set-up was portable on a bicycle. Achieved an increment of 800% in speed by optimizing design
efficiency. Managed to get a hydraulic head of 33 feet.
• Thorough market research for assembly parts was done and a budget was proffered.

contributors.headline: Global Product Management - DC fast charging solutions for e-fleets and buses at ABB E-mobility

projects.title: Pipe leakages and bursts in Mumbai
projects.description:
Objective- To study possible reasons behind pipe bursts and leakages in Mumbai and propose
recommendations.
• Carried out a survey and presented a report to government city officials on the water pipeline leakages in Mumbai
• Proposed solutions to minimize pipe breaks by controlling pressure transients in areas prone to pipe
bursts

contributors.headline: Global Product Management - DC fast charging solutions for e-fleets and buses at ABB E-mobility

projects.title: Orpak Systems: Fuel Management Systems
projects.description:
Core objective of the study was to understand the market landscape for fuel management systems among the fleet segment in India.
Operated in a team of 4 to analyze customer segment specific assessment with regards to their perception, response to the solution, expectation and need gaps.
Responsible to prepare a pricing analysis model to optimize customer demand and sales of the fuel management system.
Recommended a 5 year market entry plan with key focus on large size fleet companies (more than 50 vehicles).

courses.name: Engineering Optimization and Integrating Renewables in Electricity Markets

profile_positions.description:
My responsibility as Business Head included:
> Transform market insights into product development. I overlooked an R&D team consisting of hardware/electronics engineer, embedded software engineer, product designer and a business development representative.  
> Manage key business relationships to form sales distribution channels (mainly B2B) for our value proposition. 
> Strengthening product-market fit through continuous stakeholder interview feedback loops.
> Manage a grant fund of ~250k EUR for technical development and project management.
> Build cash flows and prediction models to ascertain company financials. Pitched to numerous private investors and VCs
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description: Our start-up was selected from a batch of 100 other start-ups for the European Climate KIC accelerator programme. This program is aimed at facilitating top performing startups focussing on energy transition. We gained mentorship and guidance from experts in the field that strengthened our value proposition and personally improved my pitching skills.
profile_positions.title: Participant

profile_positions.description: Rigorous market validation for our startup. Touched base with 100+ stakeholders to gain insights into our product-market fit.
profile_positions.title: Customer Strategy Programme

profile_positions.description:
Rexel is in transition towards a more high-end service oriented company instead of a mere wholesale company. Building, testing and demonstrating a DC-project at The Green Village accelerates the innovation capacity of both internal and external stakeholders.
Work Profile: 
1) Testing the advantages & limitation of fully utilizing DC components in an office environment using PV generation as a renewable energy option.
2) Modeling the PV system along with a battery system to supply the load demand using minimal grid power.
3) Optimally sizing the DC system after the required measurements are analyzed and finally provide an overall cost benefit analysis.
profile_positions.title: Project Consultant

profile_positions.description: DC smart microgrid design and implementation at The Green Village. Worked on phase 1 to design a DC microgrid to connect distributed energy resources (PV modules), energy storage systems (aqua batteries) and loads (DC offices, houses and street lighting) on a DC distribution link. Involved in managing various stakeholders on board for the project to accommodate them as nodes in the DC network.
profile_positions.title: Project Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible to carry out preliminary feasibility studies and compare technology options for prominent industrial clients. Responsible to pitch market entry strategies to company heads.
Key Projects Undertaken: Blue Star India Ltd., Orpak Systems India Pvt. Ltd., Philips.
profile_positions.title: Junior Strategy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Working at the newly formed real estate company where I have been assigned to a property redevelopment project.
Attended numerous meetings with potential financiers and tenants as I was associated with the project since the nascent stage. Discussed terms with investors for maximum possible returns when the project reaches completion.
Was involved in the planning of tenant settlement scheme.
Various MHADA policies where understood and BMC documentations required was carried out.
profile_positions.title: Strategy Executive
